unnormalised: **Adaptive Learning Gains Traction in Indian Education Sector**
normalised: **Adaptive Learning Gains Traction in Indian Education Sector**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – August 15, 2024 – The implementation of adaptive learning platforms is rapidly expanding across Indian schools and universities, promising a more personalized and effective educational experience. A recent study by IIT Kanpur highlights the significant improvements in student comprehension and retention rates observed when using AI-powered adaptive learning tools, particularly in STEM subjects.
normalised: New Delhi, India – August fifteen, two thousand and twenty four – The implementation of adaptive learning platforms is rapidly expanding across Indian schools and universities, promising a more personalized and effective educational experience. A recent study by I I T Kanpur highlights the significant improvements in student comprehension and retention rates observed when using A I powered adaptive learning tools, particularly in S T E M subjects.

unnormalised: Adaptive learning systems assess a student’s understanding in real-time and adjust the difficulty of the material presented, ensuring optimal learning pace. The system personalizes learning like customized tutoring. Several schools in Maharashtra are already piloting adaptive learning solutions to address learning gaps, inspired by systems seen in the movie "3 Idiots" which advocated tailored learning approaches.

unnormalised: This surge in adoption is also fueled by government initiatives and increased investment in EdTech. Companies are also developing regional language support features, making education more accessible. A leading Indian EdTech firm, "ShikshaSphere," recently secured Rs. 50 million in Series A funding to further develop its adaptive learning platform and expand its reach to rural schools, even ones 150 km from a major city. The focus is ensuring quality education for all.
